screen1.title: Yivi is your mobile identity
screen1.text: Your official name, date of birth, address, and more. All safely stored in your Yivi app.

screen2.title: Reveal your identity with Yivi
screen2.text: Easy, safe, and fast. Only you have control.

screen3.title: Yivi provides certainty, to you and to others
screen3.text: Your data are stored solely within the Yivi app. Only you have access.

choose_pin.title: Choose PIN
choose_pin.error: PINs do not match. Choose a new PIN.

provide_email.title: Add an email address
provide_email.instruction: An email address allows you to disable your Yivi app when your mobile has been lost or stolen.
provide_email.error: This is not a valid email address
provide_email.skip_content: Protect your data. When you enter an email address, you can to disable your Yivi app when your mobile has been lost or stolen.

about.title: About Yivi
about.slogan: With Yivi only you have control over your data.
about.who_is_behind_yivi_item: Who is behind the Yivi app?
about.who_is_behind_yivi_explanation:
Yivi is produced by the **Privacy by Design** foundation. In 2016 this foundation grew out of the Digital Security research group at Radboud University Nijmegen. This foundation is independent and non-profit.

The Yivi app is open source and is developed jointly with SIDN, the manager of the .nl-domain. This development is done jointly with local government and health care. Some 30 municipalities are involved, including Nijmegen, Amsterdam and Leiden. Yivi is recipient of the Dutch Privacy Awards 2018.
about.why_yivi_explanation:
**Yivi exists because you have the right to an online identity that you really own.** Yivi is not a commercial app that is used to track you, to profile you and to sell your personal data to third parties.

Yivi is in the spirit of the [General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)](https://gdpr-info.eu/). Via the Yivi app you disclose only these data about yourself that are relevant and necessary in a particular situation.

**With the Yivi app your identity is in your own hands, within the secured Yivi app on your own phone.** The Yivi app is is a powerful means for making yourself known (online) and for digital signing. With respect for your privacy.
about.privacy_explanation:
The Yivi app has been developed in such a way that you and only you can see and use your personal data. Your personal data are stored only on your phone and not in the cloud.

The Yivi app is designed so that a website or shop where you make yourself known can (cryptographically) check that the data that you disclose are genuine.

The Yivi app discloses your data directly from your phone to the website. No-one else can see that you identify yourself there. Even the organisation behind Yivi cannot observe such disclosures. 

When using Yivi, you agree with the privacy policy [link].
about.responsibility_explanation:
A website that offers an Yivi long asks data that are needed for this login. Within the Yivi app you decide whether you agree (or not) with the requested disclosure.
Does the website ask too much data? Then it is wise not to agree. You can consider filing a complaint. You can do so at the website itself or at the [Data Protection Authorities](https://autoriteitpersoonsgegevens.nl/nl/zelf-doen/gebruik-uw-privacyrechten/klacht-melden-bij-de-ap).

With the Yivi app you can also put a digital signatures. Such a signature can have (legal) consequences. Hence, putting a digital signature with the Yivi app requires care.

If you put a digital signature with the Yivi app, you agree that the Privacy by Design foundation is in no way a party in any agreement that you enter into via an Yivi signature. The foundation is neither responsible nor liable.
about.share_text: Check out the Yivi app: https://www.Yivi.app

manual.faq_info: How to use Yivi? See the explanations below.
manual.question_1: How to use Yivi for logging onto a mobile website?

answer_1.step_1: Open the website on your mobile and select logging in with Yivi.
answer_1.step_2:
The Yivi app starts automatically.
Enter your PIN.
answer_1.step_3: Agree (or disagree) to disclose your personal data.
answer_1.step_4:
After disclosing you are logged in.
You can now use the website.

manual.question_2: How to use Yivi for logging onto a website on my computer?

answer_2.step_1: Open the website on your computer and select logging in with Yivi.
answer_2.step_2: Open the Yivi app on your mobile and enter your PIN.
answer_2.step_3: Start the QR code scanner in the Yivi app. Scan the QR code on the screen of your computer.
answer_2.step_4: Agree (or not) to disclose your personal data.
answer_2.step_5:
After disclosing you are logged in.
You can now use the website.

help.title: Help
help.faq_info: Check if your question is listed here
help.question_1: What can I do with Yivi?
help.answer_1:
With Yivi it's easy to log in and make yourself known. You disclose only the necessary attributes of yourself. For instance, in order to watch a certain movie, you disclose that you are over 16 years old and nothing else. With Yivi you can digitally sign documents too. You only use relevant characteristics of of yourself, in some sort of digital stamp. In this way Yivi allows you to sign as medical doctor, as citizen, or in some other role.

More and more websites support logging in with Yivi. For instance, doctors in The Netherlands can access medical dossiers via the website [helder](https://www.helder.health/). Yivi support is growing especially at municipalities and health care providers. To get an idea of the possibilities, you can try out yourself some of the available Yivi [demo's](https://privacybydesign.foundation/demo-en/).
help.question_2: What to do if I lose my mobile?
help.answer_2:
If you lose your mobile, nobody can use your Yivi app, at least if you have chosen a non-trivial PIN.

You can protect yourself even more: upon installing Yivi you have been given the choice to enter an email address. If you have done so, you can block your Yivi app altogether via [MyYivi](https://privacybydesign.foundation/myYivi/). The Yivi app on your old (lost) mobile is then completely unusable.

If you have not yet added an email address in [MyYivi](https://privacybydesign.foundation/myYivi/) you can still do so now. This is recommended.

On your new mobile you can re-install the Yivi app and re-fill it with your data. Then you are good to go again.
help.question_3: What makes Yivi privacy-friendly and secure?
help.answer_3:
Your personal data are protected via your personal PIN. Your data are stored exclusively in the Yivi app and not in the cloud.

The data in your Yivi app are digitally signed by the source (issuer) where the data come from (such as the local authorities).

In this way a website or shop, where you make yourself known, can cryptographically verify that your data are genuine.
This exchange of personal data happens directly between your mobile and the website. No one else can see that you make yourself known there, not even the organisation behind Yivi.
help.question_4: Where are my Yivi data stored?
help.answer_4:
Your data are stored in the Yivi app on your mobile and not in the cloud.

You explicitly agree (or not) to reveal your personal data from your Yivi app to a website.
When you remove your data from the Yivi app, they are really gone from Yivi.
help.question_5: Why do the data in the Yivi app have limited validity?
help.answer_5:
Every card in Yivi shows its validity. The validity period depends on the kind of data on the card and how stable these data are. Your name and date of birth data are valid for five years, but your address data only one year. The source (issuer) of the data determines this validity period. The cards in your Yivi app may thus expire. The Yivi app then gives you a warning.

You can always, also without such a warning, refresh your cards by reloading them from the source. For instance, after year 18th birthday you can reload your data from your municipality so that you can prove that you are older than 18 now.
help.question_6: Can I install Yivi on a second mobile or tablet?
help.answer_6: Yes, on every (Android of iOS) device you can open a separate Yivi account fill it with cards with your data. It is wise to do so. If you lose one device, you can still log on with your other device.
help.send: Do you have other/more questions? Send an email. It may take a couple of days before you get a reply.

reset_pin.title: Lost PIN
reset_pin.message: Lost your PIN? We're sorry but the Yivi organization does not keep record of your PIN. If you wish to continue using Yivi, you will have to enter a new PIN and re-enter all data.
reset_pin.existing_data_title: What happens with my old cards?
reset_pin.existing_data_message: Your old cards will be deleted from your phone. If you like, you can collect new cards and start using Yivi again.
reset_pin.existing_data_removed: All cards in your Yivi app are deleted.

arrow_back.info_1: Done, your data have been disclosed.
arrow_back.safari: Tap on the name of the application (e.g., Safari, Chrome, Firefox)
arrow_back.info_2: in the top left corner to return to the application you came from.
